import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
states=pd.read_csv('states_all.csv')
states.head()

source: states[['TOTAL_REVENUE','TOTAL_EXPENDITURE']]

# TO CHECK IF THERE ARE OUTLIERS
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = (10,4)
plt.hist(states['TOTAL_EXPENDITURE'].dropna())
plt.title('TOTAL_EXPENDITURE')
#BOTH hAVE outliers,rightly skewed data.

plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = (10,4)
plt.hist(states['TOTAL_REVENUE'])
plt.title('TOTAL_REVENUE')
#2 handling OUTLIERS
by winsorizing

from scipy.stats.mstats import winsorize
winsorizing1= winsorize(np.array(states['TOTAL_REVENUE'].dropna()), (0.10, 0.10))
winsorizing1
plt.hist(winsorizing1)

#To check if there is any outlier after winsorinzing 'TOTAL_REVENUE':
#z score
from scipy.stats import zscore
zscores=zscore(states['TOTAL_REVENUE'])
z1=len((np.where(zscores>3))[0]) 
z1

#'TOTAL_EXPENDITURE' 
from scipy.stats.mstats import winsorize
winsorizing2= winsorize(np.array(states['TOTAL_EXPENDITURE'].dropna()), (0.10, 0.10))
winsorizing2
plt.hist(winsorizing2)

#To check if there is any outlier after winsorinzing TOTAL_EXPENDITURE:
#z score
from scipy.stats import zscore
zscores=zscore(states['TOTAL_EXPENDITURE'])
z2=len((np.where(zscores>3))[0]) 
z2

#3 BugdetDeficit
states['bd']=states['TOTAL_EXPENDITURE']-states['TOTAL_REVENUE']
print(plt.hist(states['bd'].dropna()))
#it seems like a bit skewed data, it seems like it has some ouliers

#eliminating
from scipy.stats.mstats import winsorize
winsorizing3= winsorize(np.array(states['bd'].dropna()), (0.10, 0.10))
winsorizing3
plt.hist(winsorizing3)

#To check if there is any outlier after winsorinzing budget deficit:
#z score
from scipy.stats import zscore
zscores=zscore(states['bd'])
z3=len((np.where(zscores>3))[0]) 
z3

#4 
winsorizing2:winsorized total expenditure ,winsorizing1:winsorized  total revenue
w4=np.array(winsorizing2)-np.array(winsorizing1) # budget deficit after winsorized values
states['w4']
plt.hist(w4)

#To check if there is any outlier in newbudget deficit,which is w4:
from scipy.stats import zscore
zscore4=zscore(states['w4'])
z4=len((np.where(zscores4>3))[0]) 
z4

plt.hist(states['winsorizing3'])
plt.title('hist of winsorizing budget deficit with originals')
plt.subplot(1,2,2)
plt.hist(states['w4'])
plt.title('hist of  budget deficit after winsorizing orginals')
